Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander band between triple lines; part of pendant roundel below, as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, part of the head of a sphinx facing left is visible on the sherd; an error, unless a fragment has been lost. Lemos places this sherd in the Chalice Style. The presence of the pendant roundel suggests that the sherd is from the earlier Mature Animal Style. Both the interior decoration and the rim pattern are also consistent with this earlier style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no. 878)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0570) (phase 2)
